title: The ASP-based concretizer cannot solve for targets which are not ancestors of the host
body:
When trying to specify the target of a spec to something that is not an ancestor of the host, the new concretizer fails with an unsat core.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack arch
linux-ubuntu18.04-broadwell

$ spack solve zlib target=x86_64
==> Best of 0 answers.
==> Optimization: [0, 0, -3, 0, 0, 1, 0, 0, -1, 8]
zlib@1.2.11%gcc@10.1.0+optimize+pic+shared arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-x86_64

$ spack solve zlib target=icelake
==> The following constraints are unsatisfiable:
  compiler("clang")
  compiler("gcc")
  default_compiler_preference("clang","3.9.1",13)
  default_compiler_preference("clang","4.0.1",12)
  default_compiler_preference("clang","5.0.1",11)
  default_compiler_preference("clang","6.0.1",10)
  default_compiler_preference("clang","7.0.0",9)
  default_compiler_preference("clang","8.0.0",8)
  default_compiler_preference("clang","9.0.0",7)
  default_compiler_preference("gcc","10.1.0",0)
  default_compiler_preference("gcc","4.8",6)
  default_compiler_preference("gcc","5.5.0",5)
  default_compiler_preference("gcc","6.5.0",4)
  default_compiler_preference("gcc","7.5.0",3)
  default_compiler_preference("gcc","8.4.0",2)
  default_compiler_preference("gcc","9.3.0",1)
  node_target_set("zlib","icelake")
  root("zlib")
==> Error: Unsatisfiable spec.
```

### Error Message

Spack reports the unsat cores above.

### Information on your system

* **Spack:** 0.16.0-70-44665cb4e6
* **Python:** 3.8.6
* **Platform:** linux-ubuntu18.04-broadwell
* **Concretizer:** clingo


### Additional information

This is due to this line in `asp.py`:

https://github.com/spack/spack/blob/44665cb4e6e3a92f8b97d9612224ef52dce396df/lib/spack/spack/solver/asp.py#L1272

The issue can be solved by using:
```python
compatible_targets = [t for t in archspec.cpu.TARGETS.values() if t.family.name == uarch.family.name]
```
but that increases the time it takes to concretize the spec by a fair amount.

- [x] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
- [x] I have run the failing commands in debug mode and reported the output
